$$V004465136$$Ondu_aleph004465136$$V000324413$$Osmc_aleph000324413$$V003040729$$Ondu_aleph003040729$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph004465136$$Vsmc_aleph$$Osmc_aleph000324413$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph003040729dedupmrg174976629$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph004465136$$VSMC01$$Osmc_aleph000324413$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph003040729$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph004465136$$VMARC21$$Osmc_aleph000324413$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph003040729$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph004465136$$VAleph$$Osmc_aleph000324413$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph003040729$$VNDU01004465136$$Ondu_aleph004465136$$VSMC01000324413$$Osmc_aleph000324413$$VNDU01003040729$$Ondu_aleph003040729
book 
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> and the North 
Elana Wilson Rowe 1980- 
JSTOR [Organization]. 
Ottawa : University of Ottawa Press 
©2009 
1 online resource (xi, 218 pages) : illustrations, maps. 
$$CISBN $$V9780776618029 (electronic bk.) (discovery); $$CISBN $$V0776618024 (electronic bk.) (discovery) 
Russia [Federation] -- Politics and government -- 1991- 
Russia, Northern -- Social conditions 
Russia, Northern -- Environmental conditions 
Russia, Northern -- Economic conditions 
Russia, Northern -- Politics and government 
Russia [Federation] -- Foreign relations 
Russia [Federation] -- Military policy 
"Russia holds more Arctic territory than any other state, yet unlike other Arctic states it does not have a unified strategy identifying economic and political aims for the North. Russia's policies on the North are dispersed across a variety of fields from domestic migration politics to oil and gas development. This volume engages the disparate elements of Russian northern policy and illustrates how the centralized, relatively economically strong and politically assertive Russia of today defines and addresses northern spaces, opportunities, and challenges. As energy markets continue looking northward and climate change renders the Arctic increasingly accessible, the geopolitical interests of Arctic states will be brought more frequently to the forefront. These circumstances will make the disputed borders and overlapping sovereignty claims of the North an important topic in international politics. Given its geographic size and political influence, Russia is and will continue to be a key regional and global actor in the international politics of the North"--Provided by publisher. 
eng

$$V000171405$$Obci_aleph000171405$$V000320946$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$V003037675$$Ondu_aleph003037675$$Vbci_aleph$$Obci_aleph000171405$$Vsmc_aleph$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph003037675dedupmrg151542907$$VBCI01$$Obci_aleph000171405$$VSMC01$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph003037675$$VMARC21$$Obci_aleph000171405$$VMARC21$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph003037675$$VAleph$$Obci_aleph000171405$$VAleph$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph003037675$$VBCI01000171405$$Obci_aleph000171405$$VSMC01000320946$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$VNDU01003037675$$Ondu_aleph003037675
book 
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> rebounds 
David Edwin Wynn Owen [editor] 
David O. Robinson [editor] 
EBSCO Publishing [Firm] 
International Monetary Fund, issuing body. 
Washington, D.C. : International Monetary Fund 
2003, ©2003 
1 online resource (vi, 183 pages) : illustrations.. 
$$CISBN $$V9781451920734 (electronic bk.); $$CISBN $$V1451920733 (electronic bk.) 
Finance -- Russia [Federation] 
Russia [Federation] -- Economic conditions -- 1991- 
Russia [Federation] -- Economic policy -- 1991- 
Electronic books 
Russia Rebounds analyzes Russia's dramatic economic recovery since the country's 1998 financial crisis, emphasizing macroeconomic issues and fiscal and banking sector reforms. The crisis was a massive shock to the system and a considerable surprise to both Russians and foreign investors, who a year before had come to think that the worst of the transition from a centrally planned to a market economy was over. Macroeconomic performance since the crisis has been impressive. The book assesses the contribution of various factors underlying this recovery and highlights key policy challenges to ensure its sustainability. 
eng

Robinson -- Structural reforms and the growth outlook / Timo Välilä -- Tax reform in Russia / Dale Chua -- Public expenditure reform / David O. Robinson -- Banking crisis and recovery / David O. Robinson -- Debt crisis in Russia : the road from default to sustainability / Alejandro Santos.Academic Complete (ebrary)

$$VBCI$$Obci_aleph000171405$$VOnline Resource$$Obci_aleph000171405$$VSMC$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$VOnline Resource$$Osmc_aleph000320946$$VNDU$$Ondu_aleph003037675$$VOnline Resource$$Ondu_aleph003037675
HC340.12

OwenDavid Edwin Wynn,Owen, David Edwin WynnRobinson, David O.Russia rebounds2003[2003].97814519207341451920733bookBOOKIncludes bibliographical references.Russia Rebounds analyzes Russia's dramatic economic recovery since the country's 1998 financial crisis, emphasizing macroeconomic issues and fiscal and banking sector reforms. The crisis was a massive shock to the system and a considerable surprise to both Russians and foreign investors, who a year before had come to think that the worst of the transition from a centrally planned to a market economy was over. Macroeconomic performance since the crisis has been impressive. The book assesses the contribution of various factors underlying this recovery and highlights key policy challenges to ensure its sustainability.563868618David Edwin Wynn.Robinson, David OAcademic Complete (ebrary)2003.1589062078Washington, D.C.International Monetary Fund

book 
Implementing international environmental agreements in &lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> 
Geir. Hønneland 
Anne-Kristin Jørgensen 
Manchester : Manchester University Press 
2003 
1 online resource. 
$$CISBN $$V9781781700181 (ebook) 
Environmental law, International 
International law -- Russia [Federation] 
This systematic study considers how international environmental agreements are transformed into political action in Russia, using three illuminating case studies on the implementation process in the fields of fisheries management, nuclear safety and air pollution control. It develops the social science debate on international environmental regimes and "implementing activities" at both national and international level to include regional considerations. 
eng 
ndu_aleph004400253 
2

Geir.  Hønneland 
Hønneland, G 
Geir Hønneland and Anne-Kristin Jøorgensen. 
Anne-Kristin.  Jørgensen 
Jørgensen, A 
Implementing international environmental agreements in &lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> 
This systematic study considers how international environmental agreements are transformed into political action in Russia, using three illuminating case studies on the implementation process in the fields of fisheries management, nuclear safety and air pollution control. It develops the social science debate on international environmental regimes and "implementing activities" at both national and international level to include regional considerations. 
Environmental law, International. 
International law Russia (Federation). 
International environmental law 
Manchester University Press,

Implementing international environmental agreements in Russia

9781781700181 
book 
BOOK 
Includes bibliographical references and index. 
This systematic study considers how international environmental agreements are transformed into political action in Russia, using three illuminating case studies on the implementation process in the fields of fisheries management, nuclear safety and air pollution control. It develops the social science debate on international environmental regimes and "implementing activities" at both national and international level to include regional considerations.

An adventuring commonwealth: English mercantile and diplomatic encounters with Russia, 1553-88 -- A commonwealths-man in Russia: Giles Fletcher's early career and embassies -- Creating a feigned commonwealth: Fletcher's response to Russia -- A corrupted commonwealth: Fletcher's representation of Russia -- A commonwealth counseled: Russia's resonances in late Elizabethan England -- A controversial commonwealth: censorship, poetry and Fletcher's late career -- Conclusion. Thinking with Russia, writing English commonwealth.

003890367 
ndu_aleph 
ndu_aleph003890367 
NDU01 
NDU01003890367 
MARC21 
Aleph 
book 
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia's&lt;/span> postcolonial identity : a subaltern empire in a Eurocentric world 
Viatcheslav Morozov 
Houndmills, Basingstoke, Hampshire : Palgrave Macmillan 
2015 
viii, 209 pages ; 23 cm.. 
$$CISBN $$V9781137409294; $$CISBN $$V1137409290 
Postcolonialism -- Russia [Federation] 
Identity politics -- Russia [Federation] 
Imperialism 
Eurocentrism -- Political aspects -- Russia [Federation] 
Globalization -- Political aspects -- Russia [Federation] 
Political culture -- Russia [Federation] 
Russia [Federation] -- Foreign relations 
Russia [Federation] -- Politics and government -- 1991- 
Russia [Federation] -- Relations -- Western countries 
Western countries -- Relations -- Russia [Federation] 
"This book applies postcolonial theory to Russia by looking at it as a subaltern empire. It pushes postcolonial studies and constructivist international relations towards an uneasy dialogue, which produces tensions and reveals multiple blind spots in both approaches. A critical re-evaluation of the existing literature enables the author to produce a comprehensive account of how Russia's position in the international system has conditioned its domestic development, and how this in turn generated specific foreign policy outcomes. Having internalised the Eurocentric worldview, Russia is nevertheless different from the core European countries. This difference is not determined by 'culture', but rather by uneven and combined development of global capitalism, in which Russia is integrated as a semi-peripheral nation. The Russian state has colonised its own periphery on behalf of the Western core, but has never been able to overcome economic and normative dependency on the West. The peculiar dialectic of the subaltern and the imperial during the post-Soviet period has given rise to a regime which claims to defend 'genuine Russian values', while in fact there is nothing behind this new traditionalism but the negation of Western hegemony. Trying to 'defend' the nation from the postulated threat of Western interventionism, the regime engages in a disavowal of politics and thus suppresses popular subjectivity. The only political subject that remains on the horizon of Russian politics is the West, while the Russian people, as any other subaltern, are being spoken for, and thus silenced, by the country's Eurocentric elites and the Western intellectuals"-- 
eng 
$$Cseries $$VCentral and Eastern European perspectives on international relations series. 
$$INDU$$LHESB$$1General Collection$$2(DK 510.764 .M673 2015 )$$Savailable$$31$$40$$5N$$61$$XNDU50$$YHESB$$ZGEN 
ndu_aleph003890367 
1. The Postcolonial and the Imperial in the Space and Time of World Politics -- 2. Russia in/and Europe : Sources of Ambiguity -- 3. Material Dependency : Postcolonialism, Development and Russia's "Backwardness" -- 4. Normative Dependency : Putinite Paleoconservatism and the Missing Peasant -- 5. The People are Speechless : Russia, the West and the Voice of the Subaltern. 
Central and Eastern European perspectives on international relations series.

$$Tfindit_link 
Viatcheslav,  Morozov  author. 
Morozov, Vauthor. 
Viatcheslav Morozov, Professor of EU-Russia studies, University of Tartu, Estonia. 
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia's&lt;/span> postcolonial identity : a subaltern empire in a Eurocentric world / 
"This book applies postcolonial theory to Russia by looking at it as a subaltern empire. It pushes postcolonial studies and constructivist international relations towards an uneasy dialogue, which produces tensions and reveals multiple blind spots in both approaches. A critical re-evaluation of the existing literature enables the author to produce a comprehensive account of how Russia's position in the international system has conditioned its domestic development, and how this in turn generated specific foreign policy outcomes. Having internalised the Eurocentric worldview, Russia is nevertheless different from the core European countries. This difference is not determined by 'culture', but rather by uneven and combined development of global capitalism, in which Russia is integrated as a semi-peripheral nation. The Russian state has colonised its own periphery on behalf of the Western core, but has never been able to overcome economic and normative dependency on the West. The peculiar dialectic of the subaltern and the imperial during the post-Soviet period has given rise to a regime which claims to defend 'genuine Russian values', while in fact there is nothing behind this new traditionalism but the negation of Western hegemony. Trying to 'defend' the nation from the postulated threat of Western interventionism, the regime engages in a disavowal of politics and thus suppresses popular subjectivity. The only political subject that remains on the horizon of Russian politics is the West, while the Russian people, as any other subaltern, are being spoken for, and thus silenced, by the country's Eurocentric elites and the Western intellectuals"-- Provided by publisher.

1 
Morozov 
Viatcheslav, 
Morozov, Viatcheslav 
Russia's postcolonial identity : a subaltern empire in a Eurocentric world 
Central and Eastern European perspectives on international relations series 
2015 
2015. 
9781137409294 
1137409290 
book 
BOOK 
Includes bibliographical references and index. 
"This book applies postcolonial theory to Russia by looking at it as a subaltern empire. It pushes postcolonial studies and constructivist international relations towards an uneasy dialogue, which produces tensions and reveals multiple blind spots in both approaches. A critical re-evaluation of the existing literature enables the author to produce a comprehensive account of how Russia's position in the international system has conditioned its domestic development, and how this in turn generated specific foreign policy outcomes. Having internalised the Eurocentric worldview, Russia is nevertheless different from the core European countries. This difference is not determined by 'culture', but rather by uneven and combined development of global capitalism, in which Russia is integrated as a semi-peripheral nation. The Russian state has colonised its own periphery on behalf of the Western core, but has never been able to overcome economic and normative dependency on the West. The peculiar dialectic of the subaltern and the imperial during the post-Soviet period has given rise to a regime which claims to defend 'genuine Russian values', while in fact there is nothing behind this new traditionalism but the negation of Western hegemony. Trying to 'defend' the nation from the postulated threat of Western interventionism, the regime engages in a disavowal of politics and thus suppresses popular subjectivity. The only political subject that remains on the horizon of Russian politics is the West, while the Russian people, as any other subaltern, are being spoken for, and thus silenced, by the country's Eurocentric elites and the Western intellectuals"-- 
893451598 
2015001726

&lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> and arms control are there opportunities for the Obama Administration? 
Stephen J. Blank 
Army War College [U.S.]. Strategic Studies Institute. 
Carlisle, Pa. : Strategic Studies Institute, U.S. Army War College 
2009 
xii, 173 p. : digital, PDF file.. 
$$CISBN $$V1584873817; $$CISBN $$V9781584873815 
Nuclear arms control -- Russia [Federation] 
Nuclear arms control -- United States 
Diplomacy 
Negotiation 
Security, International 
Arms control -- Russia [Federation] 
Arms control -- United States 
United States -- Military relations -- Russia [Federation] 
Russia [Federation] -- Military relations -- United States 
Russo-American relations are generally acknowledged to be at an impasse. Arms control issues feature prominently in that conflicted agenda. Since the outbreak of the Russo-Georgian war in August 2008, both [Russia and the U.S.] have further hardened positions and raised tensions apart from the war itself and Russia's quite evident refusal to abide by its own cease-fire terms. Nevertheless, and for better or worse, arms control and its agenda will remain at the heart of the bilateral Russo-American relationship for a long time. Arms control and disarmament issues are quintessentially political as well as military issues that are among the most critical components of the bilateral relationship and regional security in both Europe and Asia. For these reasons, neither the political nor the military aspect can be divorced from the other. And for these same reasons, we cannot refuse to participate in the bilateral effort to resolve those issues. 
eng

Kathleen. Parthé

1 online resource (xix, 283 p.). 
$$CISBN $$V9780300138221 (electronic bk.); $$CISBN $$V0300138229 (electronic bk.); $$CISBN $$V0300098510 (cloth : alk. paper); $$CISBN $$V9780300098518 (cloth : alk. paper) 
Russian literature -- Political aspects 
Politics and literature -- Russia 
Politics and literature -- Soviet Union 
Politics in literature 
Nationalism in literature 
Electronic books 
Kathleen F. Parthé offers a compelling analysis of the power of Russian literature to shape national identity despite sustained efforts to silence authors deemed subversive.

$$V003975528$$Ondu_aleph003975528$$V000150746$$Obci_aleph000150746$$V003883667$$Ondu_aleph003883667$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph003975528$$Vbci_aleph$$Obci_aleph000150746$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph003883667dedupmrg142942196$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph003975528$$VBCI01$$Obci_aleph000150746$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph003883667$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph003975528$$VMARC21$$Obci_aleph000150746$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph003883667$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph003975528$$VAleph$$Obci_aleph000150746$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph003883667$$VNDU01003975528$$Ondu_aleph003975528$$VBCI01000150746$$Obci_aleph000150746$$VNDU01003883667$$Ondu_aleph003883667
book 
Everyday life in &lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> past and present 
Karen Petrone 
Mary W. Cavender 1966- 
David L Ransel 
Choi Chatterjee 
Project Muse. 
Bloomington : Indiana University Press 
2014 
1 online resource. 
$$CISBN $$V9780253012609; $$CISBN $$V0253012600 
Interpersonal relations -- Russia [Federation] -- History -- Congresses 
Interpersonal relations -- Soviet Union -- History -- Congresses 
Interpersonal relations -- Russia -- History -- Congresses 
Russia [Federation] -- Social conditions -- Congresses 
Soviet Union -- Social conditions -- Congresses 
Russia -- Social conditions -- Congresses 
Russia [Federation] -- Social life and customs -- Congresses 
Soviet Union -- Social life and customs -- Congresses 
Russia -- Social life and customs -- Congresses 
"In these original essays on long-term patterns of everyday life in pre-revolutionary, Soviet, and contemporary Russia, distinguished scholars survey the cultural practices, power relations, and behaviors that characterized daily existence for Russians through the post-Soviet present. Microanalyses and transnational perspectives shed new light on the formation and elaboration of gender, ethnicity, class, nationalism, and subjectivity. Changes in consumption and communication patterns, the restructuring of familial and social relations, systems of cultural meanings, and evolving practices in the home, at the workplace, and at sites of leisure are among the topics explored"-- 
eng 
$$Cseries $$VIndiana-Michigan series in Russian and East European studies. 
$$IBCI$$LBCI$$1Main Collection$$2(DK 32 .E776 2014 )$$Savailable$$31$$40$$5N$$60$$XBCI50$$YBCI$$ZMAIN$$Obci_aleph000150746$$IBCI$$SavailableavailablePapers from an interdisciplinary workshop entitled "Everyday Life in Russia and the Soviet Union," held in May 2010 on Indiana University's Bloomington campus.Gift of the Jack Detzler Library Endowment. (2015)ndu_aleph003975528bci_aleph000150746ndu_aleph003883667Introduction: The Genesis and Themes of Everyday Life in Russia Past and Present -- Part I. Approaches to Everyday Life -- 1. The Scholarship of Everyday Life / David L. Ransel -- 2. Provincial Nobles, Elite History, and the Imagination of Everyday Life / Mary Cavender -- 3. Resisting Resistance : Everyday Life, Practical Competence, and Neoliberal Rhetoric in Postsocialist Russia / Olga Shevchenko -- 4. The Oil Company and the Crafts Fair : From Povsednevnost' to Byt in Postsocialist Russia / Douglas Rogers -- Part II. Public Identities and Public Space -- 5. "We Don't Talk about Ourselves" : Women Academics Recall Their Path to Success / Natalia Pushkareva -- 6. The Literature of Everyday Life and Popular Representations of Motherhood in Brezhnev's Time / Elizabeth Skomp -- 7. "They Are Taking That Air from Us" : Sale of Commonly Enjoyed Properties to Private Developers / David L. Ransel -- Part III. Living Space and Personal Choice -- 8. Everyday Life and the Problem of Conceptualizing Public and Private during the Khrushchev Era / Deborah A. Field -- 9. Soviet Mass Housing and the Communist Way of Life / Steven E. Harris -- 10. Everyday Aesthetics in the Khrushchev-Era Standard Apartment / Susan E. Reid -- 11. The Post-Soviet Kommunalka : Continuity and Difference? / Ilya Utekhin -- Part IV. Myth, Memory, and the History of Everyday Life -- 12. Everyday Stalinism in Transition-Era Film / Peter C. Pozefsky -- 13. Totality Decomposed : Objectalizing Late Socialism in Post-Soviet Biochronicles / Serguei Oushakine -- 14. Everyday Life and the Ties That Bind in Liudmila Ulitskaia's Medea and Her Children / Benjamin Sutcliffe -- Part V. Coming Home : Transnational Connections -- 15. Sino-Soviet Every Day : Chinese Revolutionaries in Moscow Military Schools, 1927-1930 / Elizabeth McGuire -- 16. Coming Home Soviet Style : The Reintegration of Afghan Veterans into Soviet Everyday Life / Karen Petrone -- 17. Everyday Life in Transnational Perspective : Consumption and Consumerism, 1917-1939 / Choi Chatterjee -- Afterword / Sheila Fitzpatrick.Indiana-Michigan series in Russian and East European studiesIndiana-Michigan series in Russian and East European studies.

Microanalyses and transnational perspectives shed new light on the formation and elaboration of gender, ethnicity, class, nationalism, and subjectivity. Changes in consumption and communication patterns, the restructuring of familial and social relations, systems of cultural meanings, and evolving practices in the home, at the workplace, and at sites of leisure are among the topics explored"-- Provided by publisher.Interpersonal relations Russia History Congresses.Interpersonal relations Soviet Union History Congresses.Interpersonal relations Russia (Federation) History Congresses.Russia Social life and customs Congresses.Soviet Union Social life and customs Congresses.Russia (Federation) Social life and customs Congresses.Russia Social conditions Congresses.Soviet Union Social conditions Congresses.Russia (Federation) Social conditions Congresses.Indiana University Press,Gift of the Jack Detzler Library Endowment. book 
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span>, 1762-1825 military power, the state, and the people 
Janet M. Hartley 
EBSCO Publishing [Firm] 
Westport, Conn. : Praeger 
2008 
1 online resource (viii, 318 pages).. 
$$CISBN $$V9780313352324; $$CISBN $$V0313352321 
Russia [Federation] -- History, Military -- 18th century 
Russia [Federation] -- History, Military -- 19th century 
Electronic books 
A study of the Russian Empire at the peak of its. military power and success (1762-1825), this important. book examines how a country with none of the obvious. trappings of modernization was able to significantly. expand its territory. Russia's military and naval. victories culminated in the triumphal entrance of. Russian forces into Paris in 1814 in celebration of the. defeat of Napoleon. Hartley's treatment is wide-ranging. and discusses many aspects of the nature of the Russian. state and society-not merely issues such as recruitment, . but also institutional, legal, and fiscal structures of. 
eng 
$$Cseries $$VStudies in military history and international affairs. 1537-4432 
Restrictions unspecified

$$V000124669$$Obci_aleph000124669$$V002507238$$Ondu_aleph002507238$$Vbci_aleph$$Obci_aleph000124669$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph002507238dedupmrg32880317$$VBCI01$$Obci_aleph000124669$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph002507238$$VMARC21$$Obci_aleph000124669$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph002507238$$VAleph$$Obci_aleph000124669$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph002507238$$VBCI01000124669$$Obci_aleph000124669$$VNDU01002507238$$Ondu_aleph002507238
book 
A history of modern &lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> : from tsarism to the twenty-first century 
Robert Service 1947- 
Robert Service 1947- 
3rd ed.. 
Cambridge, Mass. : Harvard University Press 
c2009 
xli, 687 p. : ill., maps ; 21 cm.. 
$$CISBN $$V9780674034938 (pbk.); $$CISBN $$V0674034937 (pbk.) 
Soviet Union -- History 
Russia [Federation] -- History -- 1991- 
From the Publisher: Russia had an extraordinary twentieth century, undergoing upheaval and transformation. Updating his acclaimed History of Modern Russia, Robert Service provides a panoramic perspective on a country whose Soviet past encompassed revolution, civil war, mass terror, and two world wars. He shows how seven decades of communist rule, which penetrated every aspect of Soviet life, continue to influence Russia today. This new edition takes the story from 2002 through the entire presidency of Vladimir Putin to the election of his successor, Dmitri Medvedev. 
eng

Updating his acclaimed History of Modern Russia, Robert Service provides a panoramic perspective on a country whose Soviet past encompassed revolution, civil war, mass terror, and two world wars. He shows how seven decades of communist rule, which penetrated every aspect of Soviet life, continue to influence Russia today. history of modern russia from tsarism to the twenty first century

DK 266 
1 
1 
From the Publisher: Russia had an extraordinary twentieth century, undergoing upheaval and transformation. Updating his acclaimed History of Modern Russia, Robert Service provides a panoramic perspective on a country whose Soviet past encompassed revolution, civil war, mass terror, and two world wars. He shows how seven decades of communist rule, which penetrated every aspect of Soviet life, continue to influence Russia today. This new edition takes the story from 2002 through the entire presidency of Vladimir Putin to the election of his successor, Dmitri Medvedev.ServiceRobert,Service, RobertService, RobertA history of modern Russia : from tsarism to the twenty-first century2009c2009.97806740349380674034937bookBOOKIncludes bibliographical references and index.Cambridge, Mass.Harvard University Press3130184542009009639

book 
The modernisation of &lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span>, 1676-1825 
Simon Dixon [Simon M.] 
EBSCO Publishing [Firm] 
Cambridge ; New York : Cambridge University Press 
1999 
1 online resource (xvii, 267 pages) : maps.. 
$$CISBN $$V051101905X; $$CISBN $$V9780511019050; $$CISBN $$V0511037244; $$CISBN $$V9780511037245; $$CISBN $$V051115058X; $$CISBN $$V9780511150586; $$CISBN $$V0511115962; $$CISBN $$V9780511115967; $$CISBN $$V9780521379618; $$CISBN $$V052137961X; $$CISBN $$V9780521371001; $$CISBN $$V0521371007; $$CISBN $$V9780511818585; $$CISBN $$V0511818580 
Russia [Federation] -- History -- 1613-1917 
Electronic books 
"This is the first book to place Russia's 'long' eighteenth century squarely in its European context. The conceptual framework is set out in an opening critique of modernisation theory which, while rejecting its linear implications, maintains its focus on the relationship between government, economy, and society. Following a chronological introduction, a series of thematic chapters emphasise the ways in which Russia's international ambitions as an emerging great power provoked administrative and fiscal reforms with wide-ranging (and often unanticipated) social consequences."--Jacket. 
eng 
$$Cseries $$VNew approaches to European history 
$$Cvar_title $$VModernization of Russia, 1676-1825

The conceptual framework is set out in an opening critique of modernisation theory which, while rejecting its linear implications, maintains its focus on the relationship between government, economy, and society. Following a chronological introduction, a series of thematic chapters emphasise the ways in which Russia's international ambitions as an emerging great power provoked administrative and fiscal reforms $$VBCI$$Obci_aleph000215676$$VOnline Resource$$Obci_aleph000215676$$VNDU$$Ondu_aleph002986626$$VOnline Resource$$Ondu_aleph002986626$$VNDU$$Ondu_aleph001684802$$VPhysical Item$$Ondu_aleph001684802$$VSMC$$Osmc_aleph000343757$$VOnline Resource$$Osmc_aleph000343757

DixonSimonDixon, SimonThe modernisation of Russia, 1676-1825Modernization of Russia, 1676-1825New approaches to European history19991999.051101905X978051101905005110372449780511037245051115058X9780511150586051111596297805111159679780521379618052137961X9780521371001052137100797805118185850511818580bookBOOKIncludes bibliographical references and index."This is the first book to place Russia's 'long' eighteenth century squarely in its European context. The conceptual framework is set out in an opening critique of modernisation theory which, while rejecting its linear implications, maintains its focus on the relationship between government, economy, and society. Following a chronological introduction, a series of thematic chapters emphasise the ways in which Russia's international ambitions as an emerging great power provoked administrative and fiscal reforms with wide-ranging (and often unanticipated) social consequences."--Jacket.Cambridge ; New YorkCambridge University Press512968074006136198046739Academic Complete (ebrary)

000196088&lt;/bci_aleph>&lt;grp_id>151136774&lt;/grp_id>&lt;oa>&lt;/oa>&amp;rft_id=info:oai/&amp;req.language="/>NDUHESBavailableGeneral Collection(DK 189.2 .R87 1996 )OVP000196088151136774&rft_id=info:oai/&req.language=]]>001413073151136774&rft_id=info:oai/&req.language=]]>http://alephprod.library.nd.edu/F?func=direct&amp;local_base=BCI01pub&amp;doc_number=000196088http://alephprod.library.nd.edu/F?func=direct&amp;local_base=NDU01pub&amp;doc_number=001413073https://bcezproxy.bethelcollege.edu/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;scope=site&amp;db=nlebk&amp;db=nlabk&amp;AN=622http://images.amazon.com/images/P/058500093X.01._SSTHUM_.jpghttp://syndetics.com/index.aspx?isbn=058500093X/SC.JPG&amp;client=CLIENThttp://books.google.com/books?bibkeys=ISBN:058500093X,OCLC:42328430,LCCN:95038295&amp;jscmd=viewapi&amp;callback=updateGBSCoverhttp://images.amazon.com/images/P/058500093X.01._SS[size]_SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpghttp://syndetics.com/index.aspx?isbn=058500093X/SC.JPG&amp;client=CLIENThttp://books.google.com/books?bibkeys=ISBN:058500093X,OCLC:42328430,LCCN:95038295&amp;jscmd=viewapi&amp;callback=updateGBSCoverhttp://syndetics.com/index.aspx?isbn=058500093X/SUMMARY.HTML&amp;client=CLIENT&amp;type=rn12000196088151136774&rft_id=info:oai/&req.language=]]>001413073151136774&rft_id=info:oai/&req.language=]]>OVPOVPhttp://www.worldcat.org/search?q=isbn%3A058500093X
$$V004452355$$Ondu_aleph004452355$$V003073765$$Ondu_aleph003073765$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph004452355$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph003073765dedupmrg75316020$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph004452355$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph003073765$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph004452355$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph003073765$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph004452355$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph003073765$$VNDU01004452355$$Ondu_aleph004452355$$VNDU01003073765$$Ondu_aleph003073765
book 
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia&lt;/span> before the radiant future : essays in modern history, culture, and society 
Michael Confino 1926-2010. 
JSTOR [Organization]. 
New York : Berghahn Books 
2011 
1 online resource (xiii, 296 pages). 
$$CISBN $$V9781845459932 (electronic bk.) (discovery); $$CISBN $$V1845459938 (electronic bk.) (discovery) 
Enlightenment 
Russia -- Historiography 
Russia -- Intellectual life 
Russia -- Relations -- Western countries 
Western countries -- Relations -- Russia 
Russia -- Social conditions 
One of the major historians of prerevolutionary Russia has collected in this volume some of his most important essays. Written over a number of years, these pioneering works have been revised and updated and are complemented by others being published for the first time. Thematically, they cover major subjects in Imperial Russian history and in historical writing, such as ideas and their role in historical change; the intelligentsia, the nobility, and peasant society; and historiography. The twelve essays raise cardinal questions about current scholarship on Russian history before the upheavals. 
eng

Approaches to the history of Russia -- Re-inventing the Enlightenment : Western images and Eastern realities in the eighteenth century -- Political murder in Russian culture : comparisons and counterfactuals -- Current events and the representation of the past : issues in Russian historical writing -- Afterword.The discipline and I -- The fate of ideas in history. 004123128&lt;/ndu_aleph>&lt;grp_id>98433531&lt;/grp_id>&lt;oa>&lt;/oa>&amp;rft_id=info:oai/&amp;req.language="/>00412312898433531&rft_id=info:oai/&req.language=]]>http://alephprod.library.nd.edu/F?func=direct&amp;local_base=NDU01pub&amp;doc_number=004123128http://proxy.library.nd.edu/login?url=http://congressional.proquest.com/congcomp/getdoc?HEARING-ID=HRG-2002-SGA-002800412312898433531&rft_id=info:oai/&req.language=]]>OVP
$$V003379942$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V003382613$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$Vndu_aleph$$Ondu_aleph003382613dedupmrg86022509$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$VNDU01$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$VMARC21$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$VAleph$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$VNDU01003379942$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$VNDU01003382613$$Ondu_aleph003382613
book 
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia's&lt;/span> homegrown insurgency : jihad in the North Caucasus 
Army War College [U.S.]. Strategic Studies Institute. 
Carlisle, PA : Strategic Studies Institute, U.S. Army War College 
2012 
vi, 157 p. ; 23 cm.. 
$$CISBN $$V1584875445; $$CISBN $$V9781584875444 
Jihad 
Insurgency -- Russia [Federation] -- Caucasus, Northern 
Counterinsurgency -- Russia [Federation] -- Caucasus, Northern 
Islamic fundamentalism -- Russia [Federation] -- Caucasus, Northern 
Internal security -- Russia [Federation] -- Caucasus, Northern 
Caucasus, Northern [Russia] -- Politics and government -- 21st century 
Caucasus, Northern [Russia] -- Strategic aspects 
The three papers offered in this monograph provide a detailed analysis of the insurgency and counterinsurgency campaigns being conducted by Islamist rebels against Russia in the North Caucasus. This conflict is Russia's primary security threat, but it has barely registered on Western minds and is hardly reported in the West as well. To overcome this neglect, these three papers go into great detail concerning the nature of the Islamist challenge, the Russian response, and the implications of this conflict. This monograph, in keeping with SSI's objectives, provides a basis for dialogue among U.S., European, and Russian experts concerning insurgency and counterinsurgency, which will certainly prove useful to all of these nations, since they will continue to be challenged by such wars well into the future. It is important for us to learn from the insurgency in the North Caucasus, because the issues raised by this conflict will not easily go away, even for the United States as it leaves Afghanistan. 
eng 
$$Cseries $$VSSI monograph.

$$V$$Taleph_holdings$$INDU$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V$$Taleph_holdings$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V$$Taleph_holdings$$INDU$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$V$$Taleph_holdings$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$V$$Taleph_holdings_not_in_user_institution$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V$$Taleph_holdings_not_in_user_institution$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$V$$Taleph_backlink$$DNotre Dame Catalog$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V$$Taleph_backlink$$DNotre Dame Catalog [electronic resource]$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$V$$Uhttp://www.strategicstudiesinstitute.army.mil/pubs/download.cfm?q=1116$$DOnline Access$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V$$Uhttp://purl.fdlp.gov/GPO/gpo31826$$DOnline Access$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$V$$Topenurl_journal$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V$$Topenurl_journal$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$V$$Topenurlfull_journal$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$V$$Topenurlfull_journal$$Ondu_aleph003382613$$Tsyndetics_excerpt$$Elinktoexcerpt$$Tsyndetics_abstract$$Elinktoabstract$$Tworldcat_isbn$$Eworldcat$$Tworldcat_oclc$$Eworldcat$$Tamazon_thumb$$Tsyndetics_thumb$$Tgoogle_thumb$$Tgoogle_thumb$$Tfindit_link$$Ondu_aleph003379942$$Tfindit_link$$Ondu_aleph003382613
&lt;span class="searchword">Russia's&lt;/span> homegrown insurgency : jihad in the North Caucasus /The three papers offered in this monograph provide a detailed analysis of the insurgency and counterinsurgency campaigns being conducted by Islamist rebels against Russia in the North Caucasus. This conflict is Russia's primary security threat, but it has barely registered on Western minds and is hardly reported in the West as well. To overcome this neglect, these three papers go into great detail concerning the nature of the Islamist challenge, the Russian response, and the implications of this conflict. This monograph, in keeping with SSI's objectives, provides a basis for dialogue among U.S., European, and Russian experts concerning insurgency and counterinsurgency, which will certainly prove useful to all of these nations, since they will continue to be challenged by such wars well into the future. It is important for us to learn from the insurgency in the North Caucasus, because the issues raised by this conflict will not easily go away, even for the United States as it leaves Afghanistan.(OCoLC)817600465OCoLC817600465817600465Format not distributed to depository libraries.ndu_aleph0033799420033799423379942The Caucasus emirate jihadists : the security and strategic implications / Gordon M. Hahn -- The North Caucasus in Russia and Russia in the North Caucasus : state approaches and political dynamics in the turbulent region / Sergey Markedonov -- The "Afghanization" of the North Caucasus : causes and implications of a changing conflict / Svante E. Russia's homegrown insurgency : jihad in the North CaucasusThe three papers offered in this monograph provide a detailed analysis of the insurgency and counterinsurgency campaigns being conducted by Islamist rebels against Russia in the North Caucasus. This conflict is Russia's primary security threat, but it has barely registered on Western minds and is hardly reported in the West as well. To overcome this neglect, these three papers go into great detail concerning the nature of the Islamist challenge, the Russian response, and the implications of this conflict. This monograph, in keeping with SSI's objectives, provides a basis for dialogue among U.S., European, and Russian experts concerning insurgency and counterinsurgency, which will certainly prove useful to all of these nations, since they will continue to be challenged by such wars well into the future. It is important for us to learn from the insurgency in the North Caucasus, because the issues raised by this conflict will not easily go away, even for the United States as it leaves Afghanistan.817600465BlankStephen,Blank, StephenRussia's homegrown insurgency jihad in the North CaucasusSSI monograph2012[2012]15848754459781584875444bookBOOKIncludes bibliographical references.Carlisle, PAStrategic Studies Institute, U.S. Army War College814374382
